title: Mobile-based Elementary Advanced Language Competency Development Program: Integrated Text Analysis, Writing, Instructional Design, and Critical Thinking Enhancement

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic language structures (grammar/vocabulary) and educational theories (instructional design), digital device proficiency, experience with fundamental text analysis and writing
context.additional_context: Mobile-optimized content combining language education practice (writing/reading instruction) and theory (instructional design principles) in small-scale personalized learning environments using digital devices. Integrates learner-customized feedback systems and peer collaboration tools. Supports expression and reading comprehension improvement through text-based discussion forums and multimedia material analysis.

learning_goals: Within six months, learners complete 12 mobile-based language education modules (covering grammar, vocabulary, reading, writing) with ≥85% completion rate, acquiring advanced vocabulary utilization and complex sentence structure analysis skills

Learners analyze the structure and content of language education materials (texts, multimedia), achieve 90% accuracy in formative assessments of critical evaluation skills, and enhance cross-text comparative analysis and contextual meaning inference abilities

Over a 1–6-month long-term course, learners develop one language instruction design applicable to real educational settings (elementary or secondary) through project-based tasks. The design must include three mandatory elements: instructional objectives (strengthening grammar, reading, expressive competencies), activity structure (integrated reading-writing activities and creative expression tasks), and assessment methods (portfolio, rubric, self-assessment), achieving ≥80% fulfillment rate in peer and instructor evaluation rubrics
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
